text: I think the answer is that it depends on how many rows you're dealing with and how often you need to do this.  Generally, for adding rows in bulk, a database "load" operation will be faster than multiple "insert" operations, but load often requires the disabling of constraints or other such caveats that limit its utility (e.g. if the database needs to be kept online and usable by others the whole time).  That said, I'm not sure how much of this applies specifically to SQLite or your situation specifically, so YMMV.
